title: 10X Genomics Single-Nucleus Assay of Transposase Accessible Chromatin-Sequencing for Epigenetic Profiling of Adult Human Tissues
title_html: 10X Genomics Single-Nucleus Assay of Transposase Accessible Chromatin-Sequencing for Epigenetic Profiling of Adult Human Tissues

source.description:
Prepare nuclei according to the protocol "Isolation of single nuclei from solid tissues" steps 1-14.
dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.ufketkw

Resuspend nuclei in
to
of 1X Diluted Nuclei Buffer (volume depends on target concentration)
Count nuclei (e.g., BioRad T20 Cell Counter)

Check nuclei integrity under fluorescent microscope using DAPI channel. Nuclei should appear distinct, with rounded borders and the majority occurring as singlets. High clumping rates would indicate damaged nuclei and would require re-filtering using 30-µm CellTrics filter or exclusion.

Dilute nuclei stock to be in the 1000-3200 nuclei per uL range in
total volume using the 1X Diluted Nuclei Buffer.

source.body:
If nuclei concentrations fall below the target range, then centrifugation can be performed to increase nuclei concentrations to be within range
  • Start with nuclei stock in PBS with 0.1% BSA. Add 5-10X volumes of 1X Diluted Nuclei Buffer (e.g. add 1 mL if nuclei stock is 100 uL)
  • Spin 900xg for 10 minutes (use 500xg if total #nuclei > 100k)
  • Resuspend in an appropriate volume of the 1X Diluted Nuclei Buffer.
  • Use 2-5 uL to count; 5 uL for loading
QC cutoff: minimum of 10,000 nuclei.
Caution: BSA is necessary to avoid clumping and prevent nuclei loss from sticking to the tube during the spin down. DO NOT USE more than 0.01% BSA in nuclei stock

source.description:
Prepare Reagents for use
Equilibrate gel beads to room temperature for
.
  1. Thaw, vortex, and centrifuge Barcoding Reagent and Reducing Agent B. Verify no precipitate in Reducing Agent B.
  2. Centrifuge Barcoding Enzyme briefly before adding to Master Mix.

Prepare Master Mix
Prepare Master Mix on ice (follow the recipe from the
User Guide
). Pipette mix 15X and centrifuge briefly.
Add
Master Mix to each tube of transposed nuclei on ice.

Load Chromium Single Cell E Chip
1. Assemble Chromium Chip E in a 10X Chip Holder.
2. Must load chip in order according to row label for microfluidic channels to work properly: Row 1 → Row 2 → Row 3
3. Make sure NO bubbles are introduced while loading chip.
4. Dispense 50% glycerol solution into unused Chip Wells (if <8 samples used per chip)
a.
into unused wells in Row 1
b.
into unused wells in Row 2
c.
into unused wells in Row 3
5. Load
Master Mix and Transposed Nuclei Suspension into the bottom center of each well in Row 1 without introducing bubbles.
6. Snap the Gel Bead strip into a 10X Vortex Adapter. Vortex
. Remove the Gel Bead strip and flick sharply downward to ensure maximum recovery. Confirm there are no bubbles at the bottom of the tubes and liquid levels look even.
7. Load
gel beads in Row 2. Only puncture the foil seal for gel bead tubes being used. Dispense slowly and without introducing bubbles.
8. Load
partitioning oil into each Row 3 by pipetting two aliquots of
.
9. Attach 10X gasket. Align the top-notch. Ensure gasket holes are aligned with the wells. Avoid touching the smooth gasket surface. Do not press down on the gasket.

Run the Chromium Controller
  1. Press the eject button on the controller to eject.
  2. Place the assembled chip with the gasket in the tray. Press the button to retract the tray.
  3. Confirm the program on screen. Press the play button.
At completion of the run (~
), the controller will chime. Proceed immediately to the next step.

Transfer GEMs
  1. Chill strip tubes on ice.
  2. Press the eject button to remove the chip.
  3. Discard the gasket. Open the chip holder. Fold the lid back until it clicks to expose the wells at 45 degrees.
  4. Check the volume in rows 1-3. Abnormally high volume in any well indicates a clog.
Slowly aspirate
GEMs from the lowest points of the Recovery Wells without creating a seal between the pipette tips and the wells.
6. Slowly dispense (~
) GEMs into the tube strip on ice with the pipette tips against the sidewalls of the wells.

source.body: GEMs should appear opaque and uniform across all channels. Excess partitioning oil (clear) in the pipette tips indicates a potential clog.

source.body:
• Use cycle number optimization table for total number of cycles
  • Maximum: load 1,600 nuclei - perform 12 cycles

    Incubate sample with beads for

    Elute with
    Qiagen Buffer EB. Incubate for

    eluant to a new strip tube.
    Store at
    for up to
    or at
    for up to 4 weeks. Or proceed to the next step.

MiSeq Sequencing - QC for estimation of library quality and number of nuclei captured, target 10,000 reads per nucleus
1. Paired End, Single Indexing
a. Read 1: 50 cycles
b. i7 Index: 8 cycles
c. i5 Index: 16 cycles
d. Read 2: 50 cycles
2. Library Loading
a. 10X recommended Loading concentration: 11 pM
b. Optional: 1% PhiX
3. Output
a. 22-25 million reads

NovaSeq Sequencing (target - 50,000-100,000 reads per nucleus)
1. Paired End, Single Indexing
a. Read 1: 50 cycles
b. i7 Index: 8 cycles
c. i5 Index: 16 cycles
d. Read 2: 50 cycles
2. Library Loading
a. 10X recommended Loading concentration: 280 pM
b. Optional: 1% PhiX
3. Output
a. SP: 650–800 million reads
b. S1: 1.3–1.6 billion reads
c. S2: 3.3 –4.1 billion reads
d. S4: 8-10 billion reads

source.title: Cell Ranger Mapping and Analysis Pipeline

source.description:
a. Generate Sample Sheet
b. Generate fastq files
c. Run count for each sample

source.body: Use sample sheet generator provided by 10X Genomics to generate a "SampleSheet.csv":Sample Sheet Generator

Use mkfastq command, e.g.:
cellranger-atac mkfastq --id=sample1 --run=/IlluminaOutput/Run --samplesheet=Samplesheet.csv

Use count command, e.g.:
cellranger-atac count --id=sample1 --reference=/opt/refdata-cellranger-arc-GRCh38-2020-A-2.0.0 --fastqs=/IlluminaOutput/Run/fastq_path --sample=mysample --localcores=8 --localmem=64

source.description:
Prepare transposition mix.
  1. Thaw, vortex and centrifuge ATAC buffer and store on ice.
  2. Centrifuge briefly ATAC Enzyme and store on ice.
Prepare a master mix of
ATAC buffer and
ATAC Enzyme for each sample. Mix thoroughly.
Aliquot
of prepared master mix each tube of a PCR 8-tube strip on ice.
Add
of nuclei suspension for each sample to the tube of master mix on ice.
Pipette to mix gently with P-20 set at
6X. Do not centrifuge.

Post Sample Index PCR Double Sided Size Selection - SPRIselect
Vortex to resuspend the SPRIselect reagent. Add
SPRIselect reagent (0.4X) to each sample and pipette mix 15X.
Incubate
at room temperature.
  1. Centrifuge briefly
  2. Place sample on the magnetic separator. DO NOT discard the supernatant.
  3. Transfer
  5. supernatant to a new tube strip tube.
  6. Vortex to resuspend the SPRIselect reagent. Add
  8. SPRIselect reagent (1.14X) to each sample and pipette mix 15X.
  9. Place sample on the magnetic separator and remove supernatant. DO NOT discard any beads.
Transfer
supernatant to a new tube strip tube.
Vortex to resuspend the SPRIselect reagent. Add
SPRIselect reagent (1.14X) to each sample and pipette mix 15X.
    Wash twice with

source.body:
Post Library Construction QC:
Quantify library (e.g. using Qubit dsDNA HS assay).
Estimate library size range (e.g. using TapeStation or Bioanalyzer) - expected size range is 170-700bp and including nucleosome pattern of at least 3 different bands/peaks.

materials.name: Chromium™ Single Cell 3 GEM Library & Gel Bead Kit v3
Chromium Chip B Single Cell Kit

description:
10x Genomics Single Cell ATAC (v1) sequencing is a microdroplet-based method that allows for the effective capture, sequencing and profiling of accessible chromatin in single nuclei. Chromatin accessibility is a major determinant of gene regulation, defining the transcriptional regulatory networks that determine cellular identity and function as well as additional biological processes (e.g., differentiation, proliferation, development and responses to the extracellular environment). Chromatin accessibility sequencing (ATAC-seq) provides insight into the upstream regulatory landscape associated with open and accessible chromatin regions.
References
1. Lake et al. (2016). Science, doi:10.1126/science.aaf1204.
2. Lake et al. (2018). Nature Biotechnology, doi:10.1038/nbt.4038.
3. Lake et al. (2019). Nature Communications, doi:10.1038/s41467-019-10861-2.
4. Chromium Single Cell ATAC Reagent Kits User Guide v1 (Rev B) CG000168, support.10xgenomics.com.
5. Lake and Zhang. Nuclei Isolation Protocol Applicable to Adult Human Kidney Tissues, kpmp.org/researcher-resources.
